00019 Slices::Slices(uint n_slices, int n_sigma, ftype cut_left, ftype cut_right,
00020                cuts_unit_type cuts_unit, fit_type fit_option,
00021                bool direct_slicing)
00022 {
00023     this->n_slices = n_slices;
00024     this->cut_left = cut_left;
00025     this->cut_right = cut_right;
00026     this->cuts_unit = cuts_unit;
00027     this->fit_option = fit_option;
00028     this->n_sigma = n_sigma;
00029     this->n_macroparticles.resize(n_slices, 0);
00030     this->edges.resize(n_slices + 1, 0.0);
00031     this->bin_centers.resize(n_slices, 0.0);
00032 
00033     set_cuts();
00034 
00035     if (direct_slicing) track();
00036 }

00038 Slices::~Slices() { fft::destroy_plans(); }

00040 void Slices::set_cuts()
00041 {
00042     auto Beam = Context::Beam;
00043     /*
00044     *Method to set the self.cut_left and self.cut_right properties. This is
00045     done as a pre-processing if the mode is set to 'const_space', for
00046     'const_charge' this is calculated each turn.*
00047     *The frame is defined by :math:`n\sigma_{RMS}` or manually by the user.
00048     If not, a default frame consisting of taking the whole bunch +5% of the
00049     maximum distance between two particles in the bunch will be taken
00050     in each side of the frame.*
00051     */
00052 
00053     if (cut_left == 0 && cut_right == 0) {
00054         if (n_sigma == 0) {
00055             sort_particles();
00056             cut_left =
00057                 Beam->dt.front() - 0.05 * (Beam->dt.back() - Beam->dt.front());
00058             cut_right =
00059                 Beam->dt.back() + 0.05 * (Beam->dt.back() - Beam->dt.front());
00060         } else {
00061             ftype mean_coords = mymath::mean(Beam->dt.data(), Beam->dt.size());
00062             ftype sigma_coords = mymath::standard_deviation(
00063                                      Beam->dt.data(), Beam->dt.size(), mean_coords);
00064             cut_left = mean_coords - n_sigma * sigma_coords / 2;
00065             cut_right = mean_coords + n_sigma * sigma_coords / 2;
00066         }
00067     } else {
00068         cut_left = convert_coordinates(cut_left, cuts_unit);
00069         cut_right = convert_coordinates(cut_right, cuts_unit);
00070     }
00071 
00072     mymath::linspace(edges.data(), cut_left, cut_right, n_slices + 1);
00073     for (uint i = 0; i < bin_centers.size(); ++i)
00074         bin_centers[i] = (edges[i + 1] + edges[i]) / 2;
00075 }
00076 
00077 void Slices::sort_particles()
00078 {
00079     /*
00080     *Sort the particles with respect to their position.*
00081     */
00082 
00083     auto Beam = Context::Beam;
00084     struct API particle {
00085         ftype dE;
00086         ftype dt;
00087         int id;
00088         bool operator<(const particle &other) const
00089         {
00090             return dt < other.dt;
00091         }
00092     };
00093 
00094     std::vector<particle> particles(Beam->dE.size());
00095     for (uint i = 0; i < particles.size(); i++)
00096         particles[i] = {Beam->dE[i], Beam->dt[i], Beam->id[i]};
00097 
00098     std::sort(particles.begin(), particles.end());
00099 
00100     for (uint i = 0; i < particles.size(); i++) {
00101         Beam->dE[i] = particles[i].dE;
00102         Beam->dt[i] = particles[i].dt;
00103         Beam->id[i] = particles[i].id;
00104     }
00105 }
00106 
00107 inline ftype Slices::convert_coordinates(const ftype cut,
00108         const cuts_unit_type type)
00109 {
00110     auto RfP = Context::RfP;
00111     /*
00112     *Method to convert a value from one input_unit_type to 's'.*
00113     */
00114     if (type == s) {
00115         return cut;
00116     } else if (type == rad) {
00117         return cut / RfP->omega_RF[RfP->idx][RfP->counter];
00118     } else {
00119         dprintf("WARNING: We were supposed to have either s or rad\n");
00120     }
00121     return 0.0;
00122 }

00124 void Slices::track()
00125 {
00126     slice_constant_space_histogram();
00127     if (fit_option == fit_type::gaussian_fit)
00128         gaussian_fit();
00129 }
00130 
00131 inline void Slices::slice_constant_space_histogram()
00132 {
00133     /*
00134     *Constant space slicing with the built-in numpy histogram function,
00135     with a constant frame. This gives the same profile as the
00136     slice_constant_space method, but no compute statistics possibilities
00137     (the index of the particles is needed).*
00138     *This method is faster than the classic slice_constant_space method
00139     for high number of particles (~1e6).*
00140     */
00141     auto Beam = Context::Beam;
00142 
00143     histogram(Beam->dt.data(), n_macroparticles.data(), cut_left, cut_right,
00144               n_slices, Beam->n_macroparticles);
00145 }
00146 
00147 inline void Slices::histogram(const ftype *__restrict input,
00148                               int *__restrict output, const ftype cut_left,
00149                               const ftype cut_right, const uint n_slices,
00150                               const uint n_macroparticles)
00151 {
00152 
00153     const ftype inv_bin_width = n_slices / (cut_right - cut_left);
00154     // const ftype range = cut_right - cut_left;
00155     // histogram is faster with ints
00156     typedef int hist_t;
00157     hist_t *h;
00158     #pragma omp parallel
00159     {
00160         const auto threads = omp_get_num_threads();
00161         const auto id = omp_get_thread_num();
00162         auto tile =
00163             static_cast<int>((n_macroparticles + threads - 1) / threads);
00164         auto start = id * tile;
00165         auto end = std::min(start + tile, (int)n_macroparticles);
00166         const auto row = id * n_slices;
00167 
00168         #pragma omp single
00169         h = (hist_t *)calloc(threads * n_slices, sizeof(hist_t));
00170 
00171         const auto h_row = &h[row];
00172 
00173         for (int i = start; i < end; ++i) {
00174             const ftype a = input[i];
00175             // const ftype a = (input[i] - cut_left);
00176             if (a < cut_left || a > cut_right)
00177                 continue;
00178             const uint ffbin =
00179                 static_cast<uint>((a - cut_left) * inv_bin_width);
00180 
00181             // if (a < 0)
00182             //    continue;
00183 
00184             // const uint ffbin = static_cast<uint>(a * inv_bin_width);
00185 
00186             // if (ffbin >= n_slices)
00187             //    continue;
00188 
00189             h_row[ffbin]++;
00190         }
00191         #pragma omp barrier
00192 
00193         tile = (n_slices + threads - 1) / threads;
00194         start = id * tile;
00195         end = std::min(start + tile, (int)n_slices);
00196 
00197         for (int i = start; i < end; i++)
00198             output[i] = 0;
00199         // memset(&output[start], 0, (end-start) * sizeof(ftype));
00200 
00201         for (int i = 0; i < threads; ++i) {
00202             const int r = i * n_slices;
00203             for (int j = start; j < end; ++j) {
00204                 output[j] += h[r + j];
00205             }
00206         }
00207     }
00208     if (h)
00209         free(h);
00210 }
00211 
00212 void Slices::track_cuts()
00213 {
00214     /*
00215     *Track the slice frame (limits and slice position) as the mean of the
00216     bunch moves.
00217     Requires Beam statistics!
00218     Method to be refined!*
00219     */
00220     auto Beam = Context::Beam;
00221 
00222     ftype delta = Beam->mean_dt - 0.5 * (cut_left + cut_right);
00223     cut_left += delta;
00224     cut_right += delta;
00225     for (uint i = 0; i < n_slices + 1; ++i) {
00226         edges[i] += delta;
00227     }
00228     for (uint i = 0; i < n_slices; ++i) {
00229         bin_centers[i] += delta;
00230     }
00231 }
00232 
00233 inline void Slices::smooth_histogram(const ftype *__restrict input,
00234                                      int *__restrict output,
00235                                      const ftype cut_left,
00236                                      const ftype cut_right, const uint n_slices,
00237                                      const uint n_macroparticles)
00238 {
00239 
00240     uint i;
00241     ftype a;
00242     ftype fbin;
00243     ftype ratioffbin;
00244     ftype ratiofffbin;
00245     ftype distToCenter;
00246     uint ffbin = 0;
00247     uint fffbin = 0;
00248     const ftype inv_bin_width = n_slices / (cut_right - cut_left);
00249     const ftype bin_width = (cut_right - cut_left) / n_slices;
00250 
00251     for (i = 0; i < n_slices; i++) {
00252         output[i] = 0;
00253     }
00254 
00255     for (i = 0; i < n_macroparticles; i++) {
00256         a = input[i];
00257         if ((a < (cut_left + bin_width * 0.5)) ||
00258                 (a > (cut_right - bin_width * 0.5)))
00259             continue;
00260         fbin = (a - cut_left) * inv_bin_width;
00261         ffbin = (uint)(fbin);
00262         distToCenter = fbin - (ftype)(ffbin);
00263         if (distToCenter > 0.5)
00264             fffbin = (uint)(fbin + 1.0);
00265         ratioffbin = 1.5 - distToCenter;
00266         ratiofffbin = 1 - ratioffbin;
00267         if (distToCenter < 0.5)
00268             fffbin = (uint)(fbin - 1.0);
00269         ratioffbin = 0.5 - distToCenter;
00270         ratiofffbin = 1 - ratioffbin;
00271         output[ffbin] = output[ffbin] + ratioffbin;
00272         output[fffbin] = output[fffbin] + ratiofffbin;
00273     }
00274 }

00276 void Slices::slice_constant_space_histogram_smooth()
00277 {
00278     /*
00279     At the moment 4x slower than slice_constant_space_histogram but smoother.
00280     */
00281     auto Beam = Context::Beam;
00282 
00283     smooth_histogram(Beam->dt.data(), this->n_macroparticles.data(), cut_left,
00284                      cut_right, n_slices, Beam->n_macroparticles);
00285 }
00286 
00287 void Slices::rms()
00288 {
00289 
00290     /*
00291     * Computation of the RMS bunch length and position from the line density
00292     (bunch length = 4sigma).*
00293     */
00294     auto Beam = Context::Beam;
00295 
00296     f_vector_t lineDenNormalized(n_slices); // = new ftype[n_slices];
00297     f_vector_t array(n_slices);             // = new ftype[n_slices];
00298 
00299     ftype timeResolution = bin_centers[1] - bin_centers[0];
00300     ftype trap = mymath::trapezoid(n_macroparticles.data(), timeResolution,
00301                                    Beam->n_macroparticles);
00302 
00303     for (uint i = 0; i < n_slices; ++i)
00304         lineDenNormalized[i] = n_macroparticles[i] / trap;
00305 
00306     for (uint i = 0; i < n_slices; ++i)
00307         array[i] = bin_centers[i] * lineDenNormalized[i];
00308 
00309     bp_rms = mymath::trapezoid(array.data(), timeResolution, n_slices);
00310 
00311     for (uint i = 0; i < n_slices; ++i)
00312         array[i] = (bin_centers[i] - bp_rms) * (bin_centers[i] - bp_rms) *
00313                    lineDenNormalized[i];
00314 
00315     ftype temp = mymath::trapezoid(array.data(), timeResolution, n_slices);
00316     bl_rms = 4 * std::sqrt(temp);
00317 }
00318 
00319 void Slices::fwhm(const ftype shift)
00320 {
00321 
00322     /*
00323     * Computation of the bunch length and position from the FWHM
00324     assuming Gaussian line density.*
00325     */
00326     uint max_i = mymath::max(n_macroparticles.data(), n_slices, 1);
00327     ftype half_max = shift + 0.5 * (n_macroparticles[max_i] - shift);
00328     ftype timeResolution = bin_centers[1] - bin_centers[0];
00329 
00330     // First aproximation for the half maximum values
00331 
00332     int i = 0;
00333     while (n_macroparticles[i] < half_max && i < (int)n_slices)
00334         i++;
00335     int taux1 = i;
00336     i = n_slices - 1;
00337     while (i >= 0 && n_macroparticles[i] < half_max)
00338         i--;
00339     int taux2 = i;
00340 
00341     // dprintf("taux1, taux2 = %d, %d\n", taux1, taux2);
00342     ftype t1, t2;
00343 
00344     // maybe we could specify what kind of exceptions may occur here
00345     // numerical (divide by zero) or index out of bounds
00346 
00347     // TODO something weird is happening here
00348     // Python throws an exception only if you access an element after the end of
00349     // the array
00350     // but not if you access element before the start of an array
00351     // (in that case it takes the last element of the array)
00352     // Cpp does not throw an exception on eiter occassion
00353     // The right condition is the following in comments
00354     if (taux1 > 0 && taux2 < (int)n_slices - 1) {
00355         // if (taux2 < n_slices - 1) {
00356         try {
00357             t1 = bin_centers[taux1] -
00358                  (n_macroparticles[taux1] - half_max) /
00359                  (n_macroparticles[taux1] - n_macroparticles[taux1 - 1]) *
00360                  timeResolution;
00361 
00362             t2 = bin_centers[taux2] +
00363                  (n_macroparticles[taux2] - half_max) /
00364                  (n_macroparticles[taux2] - n_macroparticles[taux2 + 1]) *
00365                  timeResolution;
00366             bl_fwhm = 4 * (t2 - t1) / cfwhm;
00367             bp_fwhm = (t1 + t2) / 2;
00368         } catch (...) {
00369             bl_fwhm = nan("");
00370             bp_fwhm = nan("");
00371         }
00372     } else {
00373         // catch (...) {
00374         bl_fwhm = nan("");
00375         bp_fwhm = nan("");
00376     }
00377 }
00378 
00379 ftype Slices::fast_fwhm()
00380 {
00381 
00382     /*
00383     * Computation of the bunch length and position from the FWHM
00384     assuming Gaussian line density.*
00385     height = np.max(self.n_macroparticles)
00386     index = np.where(self.n_macroparticles > height/2.)[0]
00387     return cfwhm*(Slices.bin_centers[index[-1]] - Slices.bin_centers[index[0]])
00388     */
00389     auto Beam = Context::Beam;
00390 
00391     uint max_i =
00392         mymath::max(n_macroparticles.data(), Beam->n_macroparticles, 1);
00393     ftype half_max = 0.5 * n_macroparticles[max_i];
00394 
00395     int i = 0;
00396     while (n_macroparticles[i] < half_max && i < (int)n_slices)
00397         i++;
00398     int taux1 = i;
00399     i = n_slices - 1;
00400     while (i >= 0 && n_macroparticles[i] < half_max)
00401         i--;
00402     int taux2 = i;
00403     // update bp
00404     return cfwhm * (bin_centers[taux2] - bin_centers[taux1]);
00405 }

00409 void Slices::beam_spectrum_generation(uint n, bool onlyRFFT)
00410 {
00411 
00412     fBeamSpectrumFreq = fft::rfftfreq(n, bin_centers[1] - bin_centers[0]);
00413 
00414     if (onlyRFFT == false) {
00415         f_vector_t v(n_macroparticles.begin(), n_macroparticles.end());
00416         fft::rfft(v, fBeamSpectrum, n, Context::n_threads);
00417     }
00418 }

00420 void Slices::beam_profile_derivative(f_vector_t &x,
00421                                      f_vector_t &derivative,
00422                                      std::string mode)
00423 {
00424     /*
00425     The input is one of the two available methods for differentiating
00426     a function. The two outputs are the coordinate step and the discrete
00427     derivative of the Beam profile respectively.
00428     */
00429 
00430     x = bin_centers;
00431     const auto dist_centers = x[1] - x[0];
00432     if (mode == "filter1d") {
00433 
00434         f_vector_t temp(n_macroparticles.begin(), n_macroparticles.end());
00435         derivative = gaussian_filter1d(temp, 1, 1, "wrap");
00436         for (auto &d : derivative) d /= dist_centers;
00437 
00438     } else if (mode == "gradient") {
00439 
00440         f_vector_t temp(n_macroparticles.begin(), n_macroparticles.end());
00441         derivative = gradient(temp, dist_centers);
00442 
00443     } else if (mode == "diff") {
00444 
00445         derivative.resize(n_macroparticles.size() - 1);
00446         for (uint i = 1; i < n_macroparticles.size(); i++)
00447             derivative[i - 1] = (n_macroparticles[i] - n_macroparticles[i - 1])
00448                                 / dist_centers;
00449         f_vector_t diffCenters(x.begin(), x.end() - 1);
00450         for (auto &d : diffCenters) d += dist_centers / 2;
00451         f_vector_t res;
00452         mymath::lin_interp(x, diffCenters, derivative,
00453                            res, derivative.front(), derivative.back());
00454         derivative = res;
00455     } else {
00456         std::cerr << "Optioin for derivative is not recognized.\n";
00457     }
00458 
00459 }
00460 
00461 
00462 f_vector_t Slices::gaussian_filter1d(f_vector_t &x, int sigma,
00463                                      int order, std::string mode)
00464 {
00465     python::import();
00466     auto pFunc = python::import("utilities", "gaussian_filter1d");
00467     auto pX = python::convert_double_array(x.data(), x.size());
00468     auto pSigma = python::convert_int(sigma);
00469     auto pOrder = python::convert_int(order);
00470     auto pMode = python::convert_string(mode);
00471     auto ret = PyObject_CallFunctionObjArgs(pFunc, pX, pSigma, pOrder, pMode,
00472                                             NULL);
00473     assert(ret);
00474     auto npArray = (PyArrayObject *)(ret);
00475     int len = PyArray_SHAPE(npArray)[0];
00476     ftype *res = (ftype *) PyArray_DATA(npArray);
00477 
00478     return f_vector_t(&res[0], &res[len]);
00479 }
00480 
00481 
00482 f_vector_t Slices::gradient(f_vector_t &x, ftype dist)
00483 {
00484     python::import();
00485     auto pFunc = python::import("utilities", "gradient");
00486     auto pX = python::convert_double_array(x.data(), x.size());
00487     auto pDist = python::convert_double(dist);
00488     auto ret = PyObject_CallFunctionObjArgs(pFunc, pX, pDist, NULL);
00489     assert(ret);
00490 
00491     auto npArray = (PyArrayObject *)(ret);
00492     int len = PyArray_SHAPE(npArray)[0];
00493     ftype *res = (ftype *) PyArray_DATA(npArray);
00494     return f_vector_t(&res[0], &res[len]);
00495 }

00498 void Slices::beam_profile_filter_chebyshev() {}
00499 
00500 ftype Slices::gauss(const ftype x, const ftype x0, const ftype sx,
00501                     const ftype A)
00502 {
00503     return A * exp(-(x - x0) * (x - x0) / 2.0 / (sx * sx));
00504 }
